reviews.sentence: no so good. The cost is so high tacking account the pool rooms and general hotel conditions. Very old and poor maintenance no very clean. The service is not bad but in general the hotel people in the desk is not very efficient. the view from the rooms pool service no drinks no pool service to food or drinks carpet and general maintenance no good.
Room was very beat up. Dirty walls etc. Needed remodel updating or atleast fresh paint. Room did not reflect the typically Westin brand.

Westin needs double overhaul. The location is right on the edge of the French Quarter and is great for that purpose. The room looked like it needed to be updated. The walls in the bathroom had some damage. The tub looked old. The worst issue for us is that it had double not queen beds. And the room was huge. There was no reason for the double beds.
Ok stay. All roads leading to this hotel are under some kind of maintenance. 420 per day to valet. 270 per day to just park.

After viewing many hotels and reading the various reviews my friends and I thought that the Westin would be the best pick for our girls trip. Upon arrival the hotel staff was very friendly and the check in process was very quick. The room was clean and a nice size. The hotel was in walking distance to everything. On Saturday we had an issue with our restroom however the hotel manager was very apologetic and provided us with two bottles of complimentary wine and champagne. However on Sunday as I was entering the Buffet line located on the 11th floor a huge rat ran from one side of the eating area into the kitchen. I immediately told the chef what I had saw and he ran into the kitchen. I reported the incident to the front desk staff and they stated that they had contact maintenance. The overall stay was ok hotel management and staff are very helpful and accommodated my friends and I for the issues we experienced. However it was shocking have our room flood and actually see a rat run into the kitchen. Be sure to keep your belongings off the floors and closed.

Perfect location in the French Quarter. My husband and I loved staying at the Westin. It is a perfect location and in the middle of everything. Very nice view as well. Staff was very friendly. The only issue was that our toilet did not work correctly and we had to get maintenance to come a few times. We would stay there again for sure.
Very nice location the hotel is nice the bed itself was comfortable but stained. Maybe a bit of renovations are needed. Overall the experience was great.

Do Not Stay During Renovations. I was completely unaware of the renovations and you should avoid. There are many Mariot properties nearby that are better choices. The hotel is n’t proactive letting customers know basic facilities like the pool are closed which is misleading and dishonest. Instead of helping your customers with breakfast when the restaurant opens the staff lines up with to go containers fill them up with the food customers are supposed to eat and take off.
great location extremely spacious room. condition only a good. but as we were checking out they were beginning a major renovation of our floor so i expect it will go to excellent pretty soon.

Sadly more changes. Not for the better. The Westin will always have the wonderful views but it seems they ca n’t help themselves from fixing what was n’t broken. The hotel at one point was elegantly furnished in traditional style. Now it ’s on its second or third redecoration in very modern cheap nonfunctional furnishings. There is pedestrian modern art some unframed in the rooms. It screams cheap. Now too with the renovation that is now taking place room sizes are being cut down. What were once lovely suites are little more than standard rooms. I ’m not really sure who has taken over the Mariot chain but it has fallen to the bottom of the heap in hotels. It seems they are appealing to the lowest common denominator. Each change they make moves them further down the ladder. This hotel because of it ’s location should compete with the Ritz Carlton instead it ’s tied with the Holiday Inn.
Great location and freshly renovated.

Convenient location. Hotel is conveniently located at the Canal Place mall floors 11 across from Harahs casino. Some rooms are recently renovated and have wonderful views of the Mississippi river. Hotel does not have a lounge for Mariot Bonvoy elite members and does offer free breakfast in lieu of a club. Walkable to French Quarter and Bourbon Street and street car stops right out front. 2 bus to from airport stops at Harahs quite a bargain compared to the 35 Uber or taxi ride.

New Orleans 20. I have been to New Orleans once before but the Westin Canal Place really took my second visit to the next level. The recently renovated lobby bar and rooms are absolutely stunning. A special thank you to Pierre concierge for providing professional and personalized service for me and my friends. We had so many questions about what to see do and Pierre had answers and recommendations to it all. Very much looking forward to staying here next time I decide to visit the Big Easy.
Our room was clean updated and that staff was great.

Best River View In NOLA. The Westin New Orleans has undergone a massive updating. It is convenient to the French Quarter and nearby sites and shopping. Safe clean and well run. Love this hotel the location and its staff. Thank you Westin.

Hotel is in a great location and totally remodeled. Stayed here twice within a week. The front desk staff were amazing Brice Nichole and Robert were friendly courteous and very helpful. But it was Brice that got us to come back. Being a platinum elite means that I go to a lot of hotels I look forward to returning.
Best Location and Recently Remodeled. Location location location. Great hotel recently remodeled and close to all the great bars and restaurants.

Awesome Renovations recently done. They just finished amazing renovations on this hotel in late November 2019. We stayed here on New Years Eve. The room was very nicely done and felt new all over. The lobby bar is spectacular now with large beautiful windows overlooking the Mississippi River. I am a Mariot Rewards member and the upgraded our room to a view over the river and we had a front row seat to the midnight fireworks show from our room.
A great hotel perfect location and most comfortable rooms ever. Beautiful new rooms. And wonderful renovation to hotelNo complaints.

Right in the middle. If you ’re going to New Orleans and want to visit the French quarter downtown and the Super Dome and this is a great place to stay. Right on the Mississippi river and the view is breathtaking. Recently renovated the accommodations are outstanding. We are definitely going back.
